project.teaser: The event, organised by the Belgian regions represented by the Department EWI from the Flemish Government, Innoviris from the Brussels capital region government, and SPW Economie from the Walloon government, aims to bring together researchers involved in research on digital...
project.objective:
The event, organised by the Belgian regions represented by the Department EWI from the Flemish Government, Innoviris from the Brussels capital region government, and SPW Economie from the Walloon government, aims to bring together researchers involved in research on digital technologies within the Horizon Europe programme, implementers involved in projects from the Digital Europe Programme, and policy makers working on digital policy at regional, national, and European levels.
The primary goal is to discuss policy and practical challenges hindering cooperation between the two framework programmes, particularly in terms of digitalisation. To ensure diverse perspectives, there is a strong emphasis on making this event interactive. Other objectives include fostering networking among different target groups, reviewing the functioning of the Digital Europe Programme, and providing a platform to showcase best practices in cooperation and synergy between the two framework programmes.
The event is scheduled for the 5th of February 2024 in Brussels, with visits to relevant organisations in Belgium planned for the following day.
Overall, the event aims to create a dynamic platform where researchers, implementers, policy contributors, and other stakeholders can converge, exchange ideas, and contribute to the advancement of digitalisation initiatives in Europe.
project.title: Research to Reality: Digital Solutions to European Challenges
project.keywords: Digitalisation, Research, Digital Europe Programme, Horizon Europe, digital, synergy, policy, Europe, Europe's Digital Decade, strategic autonomy

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DIGITAL-HE BEPCY24 (Research to Reality: Digital Solutions to European Challenges)
result.teaser: The European Union prioritizes digital transformation to foster economic growth and societal well-being. Through Horizon Europe and the Digital Europe Programme, the EU aims to enhance digital capacity and infrastructure. Horizon Europe, with a budget of €95.5 billion over...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Commitment of key-note speakers(s)
result.description: Our events have the goal to attract stakeholders from all target groups mentioned above. To do that sufficient attention should go to agenda setting that considers the goals that are laid out and to find the right balance between the topics discussed, and which panel members, moderators and keynote-speakers are to be invited to come speak at our event. Not only does a balance need to be find in terms of content but also in the background and status of the speakers, our event wants to attract people with different views on the issues, from different backgrounds, keep diversity in mind and strike a proper gender balance. The event is planning on attracting speakers from government, industry, and research.Special attention will go to the keynote speaker(s), this should be somebody who embodies the goal of our event and who has real experience of turning research into applications and who plays a bridging role at European level.

result.title: Website
result.description: A separate website dedicated to our event will be made. The website will be built in dialogue with the event agency. We chose not to use the official website of our department or the Belgian Presidency, because a separate website would potentially gain more attention and eventually more participants. However, all the details of our event are communicated clearly on the official Presidency website as well, and a link to the EU digital website to discover more information. The website will be available for a couple of months after the ending of our event, at least until the end of the duration of the Belgian Presidency.This website will in effect also serve as a type of limited conference app where people can access information on locations and timetables, but also make it easy to read background information of the scheduled speakers. It will be accessible in mobile format.

result.title: Hiring event agency
result.description: An event agency will be hired to support the involved partners in organising the event.

result.title: Agenda of the event
result.description: Given the goals, the project seeks to present an interesting agenda that has something to offer for alle target groups and is a balance between topics focussed on a certain technology (for example AI, Cybersecurity, Chip Technology, …), application area (for example agrifood, health and manufacturing), the practical workings of the programmes (for example on how to create successful cooperation between projects of both programmes) and policy discussions (for example how can Europe’s Digital Decade as a strategy steer the framework programmes).Besides a plenary part our event will consist of break-out rooms where different discussion methodologies can be used. Depending on the subject and what we hope to get out of it, different participation’s methodologies can be used.

result.title: Video stream
result.description: A video live stream will be set-up for the main lectures and discussions of the EU digital event. We consciously choose not to stream the entire event, as we want to encourage participants to join the event physically. We believe this will fully reach the key goals of our event, such as fostering networking possibilities. This streaming possibility will be made available on a platform that secures a safe connection but one that can also create possibilities to engage with the audience at home. Participants have the possibility to sign-up for streaming possibilities beforehand. After our event, the streamed lectures will be made available on the website and a link is sent to all participants – also those who attended physically.

result.title: Event document with recommendations and insights
result.description: After the event itself, the partners involved will work on the drafting of an 'event document' bringing together the recommendations and insights on the topic. This will be disseminated in the communication after our event.

result.title: Event organisation
result.description: Organising of the event itself, making sure everyting runs smoothly.

result.title: Networking activities
result.description: "The project aims to facilitate collaboration and knowledge exchange across various sectors by creating an exhibition area where stakeholders can showcase their work and engage in conversations related to the conference theme. This area, which we will refer to as the ""Collaboration Hub,"" will provide an opportunity for different target groups to meet, network, and foster new connections in innovative and interactive formats. The Collaboration Hub will not only promote innovation and knowledge exchange but will also encourage ongoing collaboration beyond the project period. This on-site activity will only be available to conference participants."

result.title: Promotional Video
result.description: A promotional video with involvement of the three relevant regional ministers and a EU representative will be set up, this will be used both for promotion of the event and as an introduction during the event itself.

result.title: Registration platform
result.description: A platform where the attendees can sign-up is made available as from September 2023. This allows attendees to consider whether they will join physically or online. The platform allows the organization to keep track of the number of attendees and of the contact details of the attendees if needed. The registration platform gathers all data which will be used to print badges at the event venue, what are dietary restrictions and if photos can be published or not according to GDPR rules.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
